name: Dumbbells
description: A pair of handheld free weights that allow unilateral training and a full range of motion across countless strength and conditioning movements.

name: Kettlebells
description: A cannonball-shaped weight with an offset handle that enables ballistic, hinging, and rotational exercises such as swings, cleans, snatches, and Turkish get-ups.

name: Medicine Ball
description: A weighted ball used for explosive throws, slams, and partner drills that build power, coordination, and core stability.

name: Barbell
description: A 7-ft steel bar designed to accept plates—foundation of powerlifting and Olympic movements like squats, presses, and pulls.

name: Thick Bar
description: A non-rotating bar with a 2-inch shaft that taxes grip strength in movements like cleans, presses, rows, and deadlifts.

name: Safety Squat Bar
description: A cambered bar with padded handles that shifts load forward, reducing shoulder stress and reinforcing an upright squat position.

name: Cambered Squat Bar
description: U-shaped bar that drops the load’s center of gravity, challenging balance and core strength during squats, good mornings, and lunges.

name: EZ Bar
description: A zig-zag bar whose angled grips lessen wrist strain during curling, triceps work, and upright rows.

name: Farmer's Walk Handles
description: Heavy handles used for loaded carries.

name: Landmine
description: A floor-mounted sleeve that lets a barbell arc through an angled path for presses, rows, and rotational core drills.

name: Trap Bar
description: A hexagonal bar that lets the lifter stand inside, keeping the load centered during deadlifts, jumps, and carries.

name: Weight Plate
description: Round plates in fixed weights that slide onto barbells or machines to progressively overload movements.

name: Pull-Up Bar
description: A fixed horizontal bar used for vertical pulling, gripping, and core hanging drills.

name: Power Rack
description: A four-post lifting rack with safety bars for squats, bench presses, and pull-ups. Provides maximum versatility and safety for free-weight lifts.

name: Squat Rack
description: An adjustable two-post rack that supports the bar for squats, presses, and partial pulls.

name: Flat Bench
description: A fixed horizontal bench used for pressing, rowing, step-ups, and countless accessory movements.

name: Adjustable Bench
description: A bench whose backrest and seat adjust to multiple angles for presses, rows, and core work.

name: Flat Bench Rack
description: A flat bench integrated with uprights that safely rack the bar for bench pressing.

name: Incline Bench Rack
description: A fixed-angle incline bench with bar supports geared toward upper-chest barbell pressing.

name: Decline Bench Rack
description: A bench declined below horizontal, often with leg hooks, for lower-chest pressing and sit-ups.

name: Vertical Bench
description: An upright bench with back support for seated overhead pressing when foot drive is desired.

name: Preacher Curl Bench
description: Angled pad that locks the upper arms to isolate the biceps during curls.

name: Back Extension Bench
description: Bench that anchors the lower body while the torso hinges to strengthen erectors, glutes, and hamstrings.

name: Glute Ham Raise Bench
description: Adjustable apparatus that trains posterior-chain extension via glute-ham raises, sit-ups, and hip/back hypers.

name: Dip Bar
description: Parallel bars set at torso height for body-weight dips focusing on triceps, chest, and shoulders.

name: Captain's Chair
description: A vertical frame with padded arms, used for hanging leg raises, knee raises, and Roman chair core work.

name: Cable Crossover
description: Twin adjustable pulleys that permit chest flys, presses, rows, and full-body functional patterns.

name: Cable Lat Pulldown
description: Seated cable apparatus with a top pulley for vertical pulls emphasizing lats and upper back.

name: Cable Hi-Lo Pulley
description: Compact weight-stack column with a carriage that slides from low to high, enabling dozens of unilateral moves.

name: Cable Row
description: Low-pulley machine with foot bracing for horizontal rows to strengthen mid-back and arms.

name: Leg Press
description: Angled sled that pushes away with the legs, heavily loading quads, glutes, and hams while supporting the torso.

name: Compact Leg Press
description: Smaller-footprint, seated plate-loaded press—ideal for home or crowded gyms.

name: Vertical Leg Press
description: A vertical sled machine for pressing with legs under consistent tension—targets quads, glutes, and hamstrings.

name: Smith Machine
description: Guided barbell on steel rails that locks path vertically for controlled squats, presses, and hip movements.

name: Converging Smith Press
description: Hybrid Smith machine whose bar travels on an angled, converging path—more natural shoulder alignment for pressing.

name: T-Bar Row
description: Chest-supported arm that rows a plate-loaded lever to target mid-back and rear delts with reduced lower-back strain.

name: Incline T-Bar Row
description: Chest-supported arm that rows a plate-loaded lever to target mid-back and rear delts with reduced lower-back strain and enhanced lat isolation.

name: High Row
description: Leverage machine with converging handles that pull from above shoulder height to target upper lats and rear delts.

name: Low Row
description: Lever machine with neutral handles at mid-torso height for powerful horizontal rows emphasising mid-back thickness.

name: Belt Squat
description: Sled or lever that loads a hip belt, allowing heavy squats without spinal compression.

name: Hack Squat
description: Angled sled where shoulders and back rest against pads while legs drive the platform for quad-dominant squats.

name: Pendelum Squat
description: Arc-swinging lever that loads quads and glutes with a natural, knee-friendly squat path.

name: V-Squat
description: Guided lever allows a squat with back support, blending hack- and front-squat efforts for balanced quad/glute loading.

name: Shoulder Press - Plate Loaded
description: Converging plate-loaded overhead press that isolates delts and triceps while sparing low-back stabilization.

name: Shoulder Shrug
description: Lever or sled that elevates plates with traps without the grip limitation of a barbell.

name: Seated Calf Raise
description: Lever with knee pads that loads the soleus and gastrocs through seated plantar flexion.

name: Standing Calf Raise - Plate Loaded
description: Shoulder-pad lever that loads calves in standing plantar flexion for maximal stretch and drive.

name: Viking Press
description: Plate-loaded pivot arms that simulate a log/axle style overhead press emphasizing shoulders and triceps.

name: Chest Press - Plate Loaded
description: Converging lever replicating a bench press with constant tension and natural arm path.

name: Incline Chest Press - Plate Loaded
description: Plate-loaded incline press that targets upper pectorals along a converging pathway.

name: Decline Chest Press - Plate Loaded
description: Plate-loaded decline chest press emphasizing lower-pec fibers with a stable back support.

name: Reverse Hyperextension
description: A specialized bench for strengthening the lower back, glutes, and hamstrings. Common in rehabilitation and powerlifting.

name: Neck Extension
description: Plate-loaded leverage machine that isolates the posterior cervical muscles through controlled neck extension with adjustable seat and pad positioning.

name: Donkey Calf Raise
description: Hip-hinged calf raise with weighted pad at the sacrum—maximises gastroc stretch while unloading spine.

name: Horizontal Leg Press
description: Stack-loaded platform that travels horizontally, placing constant tension on quads and glutes.

name: Pec Deck
description: A seated machine for isolating the chest via controlled fly motion. Often called a ‘Pec Deck.’

name: Shoulder Press
description: Weight-stack machine that guides the overhead pressing path while isolating shoulders and triceps.

name: Lying Leg Curl
description: Prone bench with ankle roller that isolates hamstrings through knee flexion.

name: Standing Calf Raise
description: Stack-loaded apparatus with shoulder pads for heavy standing calf raises.

name: Seated Dip
description: Guided dip lever that targets triceps and lower chest with selectable load.

name: Seated Leg Curl
description: Chair-style machine that isolates hamstrings while the torso remains upright.

name: Standing Leg Curl
description: Unilateral stack machine that curls one leg at a time—great for balanced hamstring development.

name: Seated Row
description: Weight-stack row with adjustable grip paths to build middle-back and biceps.

name: Back Extension
description: Stack-based torso-extension machine that trains spinal erectors with controlled resistance.

name: Ab Crunch
description: Weight-stack unit that flexes the spine to load the abdominal wall under constant tension.

name: Preacher Curl
description: Stack-loaded lever that isolates biceps over an angled preacher pad.

name: Bicep Curl
description: Cam-driven lever or cable that guides elbow flexion for strict biceps work.

name: Chest Press
description: Converging or parallel lever that mimics a barbell bench press while providing stability.

name: Incline Chest Press
description: Stack-loaded incline press emphasising upper pectorals with a fixed path.

name: Fly Machine
description: Pivoting pads or handles that perform chest flys and, when reversed, posterior-delt flys.

name: Hip Abduction Machine
description: Pad-on-knees machine that opens the legs to strengthen glute medius and other abductors.

name: Hip Adduction Machine
description: Pad-between-knees machine that closes the legs against resistance to target adductors.

name: Multi-Hip Machine
description: Versatile stack-loaded machine with adjustable arm positions that enables a wide variety of hip movements.

name: Leg Extension
description: Stack machine that isolates quadriceps by extending the knee against a padded roller.

name: Lateral Raise
description: Guided arm levers performing lateral raises to isolate side delts without balance demands.

name: Tricep Dip
description: Weight-stack lever that replicates body-weight dips with adjustable resistance.

name: Tricep Extension
description: Vertical cable path that isolates triceps through elbow extension while seated or standing.

name: Assisted Machine
description: Counter-weighted knee platform that reduces effective body weight for pull-ups or dips.

name: Glute Kickback
description: Levered footpad that drives rearward against a weight stack to isolate gluteus maximus.

name: Rotary Torso
description: Seated trunk-rotation machine that strengthens obliques and transverse abdominis.

name: Pullover Machine
description: Cam-driven lever that arcs a padded bar from overhead to the hips, isolating lats and serratus.

name: Handle Bands
description: Elastic tubes with fixed handles that add variable resistance for strength, mobility, or rehab; can clip to anchors.

name: Mini Loop Bands
description: Small continuous loops used around knees or ankles to activate hips and glutes or provide light resistance in rehab.

name: Loop Bands
description: Long seamless loops offering scalable tension for pull-up assistance, stretching, or resistance exercises.

name: Battle Ropes
description: Weighted ropes anchored to a point for wave and slam variations that build power and endurance.

name: Ab Wheel
description: Single or double-wheel tool with handles used for rollout variations that challenge anti-extension core strength.

name: Dip Belt
description: Belt with a hanging chain to load plates for weighted dips, pull-ups, and belt-squat variations.

name: Neck Harness
description: Padded head harness that attaches to weight plates or cable machines for loaded neck flexion, extension, and lateral flexion exercises.

name: Wrist Roller
description: Handle connected to a rope and weight plate; rolled up and down to build forearm and grip strength.

name: Exercise Ball
description: Inflatable ball used as an unstable surface for core, balance, and rehabilitation exercises.

name: Plyometric Box
description: Sturdy box or cushion used for jumping drills, step-ups, and depth landings to develop explosiveness.

name: Rice Bucket
description: Bucket filled with rice or sand in which the hand is plunged and manipulated to improve finger, wrist, and forearm strength.

name: Towel
description: Ordinary towel used as a grip implement or slider for various body-weight and mobility drills.

name: Chair
description: Sturdy household chair leveraged for step-ups, dips, incline push-ups, or seated exercises.

name: Prowler Sled
description: A sled used for pushing or pulling drills.

name: Treadmill
description: Motorized cardio machine designed for walking, jogging, or running indoors with adjustable speed and incline.

name: Rowing Machine
description: Cardio machine simulating the motion of rowing, engaging upper and lower body for endurance and strength training.

name: Elliptical
description: Low-impact cardio machine providing smooth, elliptical strides that engage arms and legs simultaneously.

name: Stationary Bike
description: Indoor cycling machine with adjustable resistance, ideal for low-impact cardio and leg endurance training.

name: Stair Climber
description: Cardio machine replicating stair climbing motion to build lower-body strength and cardiovascular endurance.

name: Jacob's Ladder
description: Self-paced cardio machine using a continuous ladder climbing motion for a high-intensity, full-body workout.

name: Double D-Handle
description: Neutral-grip cable handle suitable for rows, pulldowns, and multi-purpose pulling movements.

name: Single D-Handles
description: A universal single-hand cable attachment used for unilateral pulling and pressing exercises such as rows, flyes, curls, and triceps extensions.

name: Neutral-Grip Pulldown Bar
description: A pulldown bar with parallel (neutral) hand positioning to reduce shoulder stress and emphasize the lats and upper back during pulldowns or low-row cables.

name: Multi-Grip Pulldown Bar
description: A lat pulldown bar featuring multiple grip widths and angles that allow varied targeting of the back muscles and improved customization of pulling movements.

name: Wide-Grip Pulldown Bar
description: Angled wide bar used for vertical or horizontal cable pulling variations with multiple grip widths.

name: Dual-End Rope
description: Flexible rope with two end stops for rotational neutral-grip cable work including pulls, extensions, curls, and press variations.

name: EZ-Bar Attachment
description: A curved cable attachment designed to reduce wrist strain during bicep curls, triceps pushdowns, and upright rows. Provides multiple grip angles for ergonomic arm training.

name: Straight Bar Attachment
description: Straight bar for neutral or overhand/underhand cable pulling or pressing variations including curls, rows, and pressdowns.

name: Angled V-Bar Attachment
description: Angled steel bar with neutral grip positions for cable pressdowns and multi-angle pulling.

name: Ankle Strap Attachments
description: A padded ankle cuff designed for cable machines to target the legs and glutes with movements such as hip abductions, extensions, kickbacks, and hamstring curls.

name: Gymnastic Rings
description: A pair of circular rings suspended from straps used for advanced bodyweight exercises and various static holds that develop upper body strength, stability, and coordination.

name: Suspension Trainer
description: Adjustable straps with handles and foot cradles that use body weight and angle to create resistance for full-body functional training, core stability, and rehabilitation exercises.
